Function Documentation

void arraygetstring ( astr &  thestr,
raw_array_t &  theval,
bool  enquote = false,
bool  separate = false 
)

Iterates over the members of an array, formatting them for output.

Parameters:
thestr A reference to a std::string or std::wstring that will have the output appended to it.
enquote If true, strings and names will be enquoted before output. This is neccesary to output correct JSON
separate If true, will output each value on a separate line
theval Reference to the raw_array_t that will be converted to string.
Returns:
nothing. thestr is modified directly.

Iterates over the members of an object, formatting them for output.

Parameters:
thestr A reference to a std::string or std::wstring that will have the output appended to it.
enquote If true, strings and names will be enquoted before output. This is neccesary to output correct JSON
separate If true, will output each value on a separate line
theval The raw_object_t to be converted to string.
Returns:
nothing. thestr is modified directly.

void quotestring ( astr &  thestr  ) 

Makes thestr safe for output as a JSON string, by enquoting dangerous characters.

Parameters:
thestr A reference to the std::string or std::wstring that is to be operated on.
Returns:
nothing. thestr is modified directly.

const achar *  search,
const achar *  replace 
)

Replace all occurrences of search with replace in srcstr.

Parameters:
srcstr A reference to the std::string or std::wstring that is to be operated on.

replace The string to replace matches with.
Returns:
